thread.title: Divas’ outfits are not on the money
thread.title_full: Divas’ outfits are not on the money | Boston Herald

author: Ivana Martini
title: Divas’ outfits are not on the money
text:
So there I was, lying on the chaise and nearly finished with a session of mental Pilates, when in burst my chum Gremolata Bunion (of the Newport Bunions).
“I’ve had an epiphany!” she cried.
“Is that the one with rum, orange bitters and a whisper of Everclear?” I asked.
It turns out the dear girl learned that the U.S. Treasury is asking the public for suggestions on which fabulous personage should grace the $10 bill.
“And I immediately thought of you!”
“I’m touched and flattered. I’m tattered,” I replied. (Note to self: Remember to scowl at all the pals who didn’t suggest this). The bill gets a redesign as well, so I was thinking of a tasteful fuchsia, with a Swarovski crystal in each corner. It will make tipping the doorman much more festive.
But don’t let me influence you, morsels. Use #TheNew10 in your social media posts when you sing my praises as the rightful heir to Mr. Hamilton.
Speaking of brilliant ideas, I didn’t see a single one during my red carpet and runway stakeout this week. Let me make change for this Basic Bill, and I’ll file my report:
